network_overview: The capture contains only IMS/SIP signaling for VoLTE/VoNR calls; every call leg is eventually cancelled or times out, so no bearer/RTP is established and no user-plane traffic is present. All 20 calls fail with the same pattern: INVITE → 183/180 → CANCEL/BYE, indicating a common upstream trigger (user rejection or network timeout).

observations.finding: 100 % of 33 INVITE attempts end in CANCEL or BYE; zero successful 200 OK for INVITE.
No RTP flows detected – media bearer never established, so voice service is effectively unavailable.
PRACK and UPDATE round-trip times inside the core are < 200 ms, so transport delay is not the root cause.
Every CANCEL carries exactly the same reason text 'Call Rejected By User' (SIP cause=200), pointing to a single policy or timer.

root_causes.description: After 180 Ringing is sent the calling UE (or network on its behalf) sends CANCEL with cause 200; this is either a real user pressing 'End' or a handset/IMS-app timer expiring because no human input was detected.
root_causes.impact: Zero completed calls; subscribers cannot originate voice calls.

root_causes.issue: INVITE-setup timer expiry on long legs
root_causes.description: Four calls (call_ids M3hLVREVD5ydTfb0VA0EWIeM, ffll43qaga4q76d36gy4344yyw4g0ggl, xyess5xlhwlem643336lll43nhwr5sxi, asbcxyess5xlhwlem643336lll43nhwr5sxi) receive no final 200 OK and are torn down with BYE containing internal reason '0132.0001.0B2E', indicating an S-CSCF or MMTEL guard timer (≈ 6 min) expired.
root_causes.impact: Calls drop before answer; perceived as network failure.

recommendations.action: Check T9 (calling-party alerting) timer in MMTEL/AS and reduce it to ≤ 60 s to force earlier CANCEL instead of 6-minute BYE.
recommendations.rationale: Short timer avoids long hung sessions and releases radio bearers faster.

recommendations.action: Verify that 180 Ringing is reliably played/heard by the calling UE; if ring-back tone is missing users hang up within 30 s.
recommendations.rationale: Human behaviour drives the CANCEL; ensure early-media or local ring-back is working.

recommendations.action: Collect simultaneous RAN trace (S1-MME/NGAP) to confirm radio bearer establishment for QCI=1 and check if RRC Connection Reconfiguration completes.
recommendations.rationale: Bearer failure would prevent alerting and correlate with the timeout BYE.

recommendations.action: Audit IMS registration (REGISTER/200 OK) for the affected P-CSCF pool; missing contact or expired registration can cause AS to reject 200 OK.
recommendations.rationale: Hidden registration issues can block final answer even when alerting succeeds.

session_analysis.signaling_health: SIP transactions complete normally up to 180 Ringing; no 5xx or re-transmissions, SCTP transport is stable.
session_analysis.user_plane_health: No RTP flows detected – bearer either never requested or never confirmed; no GTP-U TEIDs observed.
session_analysis.voice_quality: No MOS possible – media never established; all calls fail before CONNECT.
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: Signaling reaches alerting state but absence of 200 OK and RTP implies either (a) called party never answers or (b) network withholds final answer due to bearer/routing issue.

sequence_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant UE
    participant P-CSCF
    participant S-CSCF
    participant TAS
    participant Remote
    UE->>P-CSCF: INVITE
    P-CSCF->>S-CSCF: INVITE
    S-CSCF->>TAS: INVITE
    TAS->>Remote: INVITE
    Remote->>TAS: 183 Session Progress
    TAS->>S-CSCF: 183
    S-CSCF->>P-CSCF: 183
    P-CSCF->>UE: 183
    Remote->>TAS: 180 Ringing
    TAS->>S-CSCF: 180
    S-CSCF->>P-CSCF: 180
    P-CSCF->>UE: 180
    Note over UE: No answer ~30 s
    UE->>P-CSCF: CANCEL (cause=200)
    P-CSCF->>S-CSCF: CANCEL
    S-CSCF->>TAS: CANCEL
    TAS->>Remote: CANCEL
    Remote->>TAS: 487 Request Terminated
    TAS->>S-CSCF: 487
    S-CSCF->>P-CSCF: 487
    P-CSCF->>UE: 487
    UE->>P-CSCF: ACK
